newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Foster's sets market for record turnover.
newsitem.headline: Foster's sets market for record turnover.

text.p: The Australian stock market headed for a record turnover on Friday as the Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd sold the bulk of its shareholding in Foster's Brewing Group Ltd.

The 671.7 million shares, worth A$1.67 billion, were specialled through the market in four parcels on Friday morning by broker Were Stockbroking and investment house ABN Amro Hoare Govett (Securities).
The shares, all at A$2.49, went through in two parcels of 308.3 million shares, one of 32.5 million and one of 22.6 million.
The previous one-day turnover record on the Australian Stock Exchange was set on May 30 when A$1.88 billion worth of trade went through the market, boosted by options related trading.
BHP announced on Thursday it had sold 86 percent of its shareholding in Foster's to Were's and ABN Amro, with the stock expected to be immediately placed in Australia and overseas.
Foster's would also buy back 254.45 million of its shares from Asahi Breweries Ltd for A$625 million.
BHP plans to offer its remaining 100 million shares in Foster's to its shareholders after October 5, 1997.
